question: A hollow sphere of radius R, a hollow cube of side R and a thin circular plate of radius R, made up of the same material, are all heated to 20Â°C above room temperature. When left to cool in the room, which of them will reach the room temperature first?
option4: All of them will reach the room temperature at the same time
explanation: The loss of heat is directly proportional to the surface area, hence loss of heat will be earlier in case of sphere because it has the maximum surface area.
